slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचभूय एव महाबाहो श‍ृणु मे परमं वच: ।यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: Again, O mighty-armed Arjuna, listen to My supreme word, which I shall speak to you for your benefit and which will give you great joy.

slokas: न मे विदु: सुरगणा: प्रभवं न महर्षय: ।अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वश: ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: The gods and great sages do not know my origin, for I am the source of the gods and sages in all respects.

slokas: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् ।असम्मूढ: स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापै: प्रमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: He who knows Me as the unborn, as the supreme Lord of all worlds, he, undeluded among mortals, is freed from all sins.

slokas: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोह: क्षमा सत्यं दम: शम: ।सुखं दु:खं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Intelligence, knowledge, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, control over the senses, control over the mind, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness.

slokas: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयश: ।भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधा: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Non-violence, equality, contentment, penance, charity, fame and infamy - these various qualities exist in beings by nature.

slokas: महर्षय: सप्‍त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा ।मद्भ‍ावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमा: प्रजा: ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: The seven great sages and four ancient Manus, who are born out of my mind, are the progenitors of this world.

slokas: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वत: ।सोऽविकल्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशय: ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: He who knows in truth this glory and power of Mine engages in unswerving devotion; there is no doubt about it.

slokas: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्त: सर्वं प्रवर्तते ।इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विता: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the source of all; from Me everything evolves. Knowing this, the wise with deep devotion adore Me.

slokas: मच्च‍ित्ता मद्ग‍तप्राणा बोधयन्त: परस्परम् ।कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: With their minds fixed on Me, their life surrendered to Me, enlightening one another and always speaking of Me, they are contented and delighted.

slokas: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.

slokas: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तम: ।नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: For their welfare, Arjuna, I, dwelling in their hearts, dispel the darkness born of ignorance with the luminous lamp of knowledge.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचपरं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् ।पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate abode, the purest, the Absolute Truth. You are the eternal, divine, original person, the unborn, the greatest.

slokas: आहुस्त्वामृषय: सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा ।असितो देवलो व्यास: स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: Sages, gods, divine sages, Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa, and you yourself have declared this to me.

slokas: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव ।न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवा: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: I believe all that You have said, O Krishna; neither the gods nor the demons comprehend Your manifestation.

slokas: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम ।भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: You alone know yourself, O Supreme Person, O Creator of all beings, O God of gods, O Lord of the universe.

slokas: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: ।याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: You should speak of these divine manifestations in their entirety. By these manifestations, pervading the worlds, you abide.

slokas: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् ।केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: How can I know You, always meditating on You, O Lord? In which forms and in which aspects are You to be meditated upon by me?

slokas: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन ।भूय: कथय तृप्‍तिर्हि श‍ृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated:
Please explain the following text in English:

In detail, the science of the Self, O Janardana, and also about divine manifestations. For, O listener, there is no satiety in hearing about the nectar-like words of mine.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचहन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतय: ।प्राधान्यत: कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Lord said: O Arjuna, now I shall describe to you My divine manifestations, which are prominent, not all, as there is no end to their extent.

slokas: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थित: ।अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

slokas: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंश‍ुमान् ।मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: Among the Adityas I am Vishnu, among the luminaries I am the radiant sun. Among the Maruts I am Marichi, and among the stars I am the moon.

slokas: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासव: ।इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Sama Veda among the Vedas; I am Indra among the gods. I am the mind among the senses; I am consciousness in living beings.

slokas: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Of the Rudras I am Shankara, of the Yakshas and Rakshasas I am the Lord of Wealth; of the Vasus I am Pavaka, and of the mountains I am Meru.

slokas: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् ।सेनानीनामहं स्कन्द: सरसामस्मि सागर: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Know Me to be the chief among the priests, O Arjuna. Among the commanders of armies, I am Skanda; and among bodies of water, I am the ocean.

slokas: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् ।यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालय: ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Among the sages I am Bhṛgu; among words I am the one syllable. Among sacrifices I am the sacrifice of silent repetition, and among the immovable I am the Himalayas.

slokas: अश्वत्थ: सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारद: ।गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथ: सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनि: ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: The fig tree, among all trees, the celestial sage Narada, among the celestial musicians, Chitraratha, among the perfected beings, the sage Kapila.

slokas: उच्‍चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भ‍वम् ।ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: Know Me to be the king of elephants, Airavata, and among horses, the Ucchaihshravas, born of the elixir of immortality.

slokas: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् ।प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्प: सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकि: ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the thunderbolt among weapons, and the wish-fulfilling cow among cows. I am the procreator, the god of love, and I am Vasuki among snakes.

slokas: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् ।पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यम: संयमतामहम् ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: Among the nagas, I am Ananta; among the aquatic beings, I am Varuna. Among the ancestors, I am Aryama; and among the controllers, I am Yama.

slokas: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां काल: कलयतामहम् ।मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: I am Prahlada among the demons, and Time among the reckoners of time. Among animals, I am the lion, and among birds, I am Garuda.

slokas: पवन: पवतामस्मि राम: शस्त्रभृतामहम् ।झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the wind among the purifiers, I am Rama among the warriors, I am the crocodile among the fish, and I am the Ganges among the rivers.

slokas: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन ।अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वाद: प्रवदतामहम् ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings, O Arjuna. Among sciences I am the science of the Self, and I am the logic of those who debate.

slokas: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्व: सामासिकस्य च ।अहमेवाक्षय: कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुख: ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the letter "A" among the alphabets and I am the dual compound of words. I am also inexhaustible time, and I am the all-devouring death.

slokas: मृत्यु: सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भ‍वश्च भविष्यताम् ।कीर्ति: श्रीर्वाक्‍च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृति: क्षमा ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: Death, I am the destroyer of all, and I am also the generator of the future. Fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, resolve, and forgiveness are the qualities of women.

slokas: बृहत्साम तथा साम्न‍ां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् ।मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकर: ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: I am the Gayatri meter of the great Sama mantras. I am the month of Margashirsha among the seasons, and I am the flower-bearing season of the Devas.

slokas: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ।जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: I am gambling among cheats, and I am the brilliance of the brilliant. I am victory, I am effort, and I am the strength of the strong.

slokas: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जय: ।मुनीनामप्यहं व्यास: कवीनामुशना कवि: ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_translated: I am Vasudeva among the Vrishnis, Dhananjaya among the Pandavas, Vyasa among the sages, and Shuka among the poets.

slokas: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् ।मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: Punishment, I am the rod of those who punish; policy, I am the strategy of those who seek victory; silence, I am the secret of the wise; knowledge, I am the knowledge of the knowledgeable.

slokas: यच्च‍ापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन ।न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: And whatever seed of all beings, Arjuna, I am that. There is no being, moving or unmoving, that can exist without Me.

slokas: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप ।एष तूद्देशत: प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: There is no end to my divine manifestations, Arjuna. This is just a brief description by me of the extent of my divine manifestations.

slokas: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा ।तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोऽशसम्भवम् ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: "Whatever glorious, powerful, or brilliant you see, know it to be a manifestation of a fraction of my splendor."

slokas: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन ।विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: Or what need is there for you to know all this, O Arjuna? With a single fragment of Myself I pervade and support this entire universe.
